description: Upgrade Medic from Python 3.11 to Python 3.14.3 - the latest stable release. Includes updating CI, Dockerfile, dependencies, and fixing any compatibility issues.

userStories.title: Fix dependency compatibility issues
userStories.description: As a developer, I need all dependencies to be compatible with Python 3.14 so the application runs correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: Update Medic/requirements.txt with Python 3.14 compatible versions
Update requirements-dev.txt with Python 3.14 compatible versions
All pip install commands succeed without errors
userStories.notes: Must be done first before updating Python version in CI/Docker

userStories.title: Update CI workflow Python version
userStories.description: As a developer, I need CI to run on Python 3.14 so that tests validate against the target runtime.
userStories.notes: Simple version number change in workflow file

userStories.title: Update Dockerfile to Python 3.14
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the production Docker image to use Python 3.14 so that deployed code matches the CI environment.
acceptanceCriteria: Update builder stage FROM python:3.11-slim-bookworm to python:3.14-slim-bookworm
Update runtime stage FROM python:3.11-slim-bookworm to python:3.14-slim-bookworm
userStories.notes: Update base image version in both stages of Dockerfile

userStories.title: Fix deprecation warnings and compatibility issues
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to resolve any Python 3.14 deprecation warnings so the codebase is future-proof.
acceptanceCriteria: Fix any deprecated stdlib usage in Medic/ directory
Fix any typing module deprecations (use collections.abc where needed)
Fix any f-string or syntax changes for Python 3.14
userStories.notes: Check typing, asyncio, collections, importlib modules for deprecated usage

userStories.title: Update type hints for Python 3.14
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to leverage Python 3.14's improved type hint features so the code is more maintainable.
acceptanceCriteria: Update mypy version in requirements-dev.txt to support Python 3.14
Update type stubs versions if needed
Fix any new type errors from stricter checking
Mypy passes with no errors on Medic/ medic.py config.py
userStories.notes: May require updating mypy and type stub packages

userStories.title: Validate full test suite passes
userStories.description: As a developer, I need confirmation that all tests pass on Python 3.14 before merging.
acceptanceCriteria: Run pytest tests/ -v and all tests pass
userStories.notes: Final validation step - run full test suite

userStories.title: Evaluate alternative Docker base images
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to evaluate alpine and distroless base images so that we can optimize for size and security.
acceptanceCriteria: Document size of python:3.14-alpine image if available
Document compatibility notes for each base image
Add comparison as comment in Dockerfile or in PR description
userStories.notes: Research task - document findings, keep slim-bookworm as default unless alpine is clearly better

userStories.title: Leverage Python 3.14 features (optional improvements)
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to use beneficial Python 3.14 features where they improve code quality.
acceptanceCriteria: Identify if any new features would benefit the codebase
Only apply changes that genuinely improve readability or performance
Do NOT refactor working code just to use new syntax
userStories.notes: Optional - skip if no clear benefit. Do not over-engineer.

userStories.title: QA validation and manual testing
userStories.description: As a QA engineer, I need to manually validate the Python upgrade so we can confirm no regressions in production behavior.
userStories.notes: MANUAL TASK - Requires human QA. Skip in Ralph automation.

userStories.title: Update monitoring and telemetry
userStories.description: As an SRE, I need monitoring updated to track the new Python version so we can detect issues post-deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: Python version exposed in application metrics or info endpoint
Verify OTEL instrumentation works with Python 3.14
userStories.notes: Add Python version to /health or /info endpoint if not already present

userStories.title: Create runbook and documentation
userStories.description: As a support engineer, I need documentation for the Python 3.14 upgrade so I can troubleshoot issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Rollback procedure documented in PR description or docs
Known issues documented if any discovered
userStories.notes: MANUAL TASK - Documentation. Can add basic notes in PR description.

userStories.title: Handoff and ownership confirmation
userStories.description: As a team lead, I need clear handoff so all stakeholders know about the Python upgrade.
acceptanceCriteria: PR description includes summary of changes
userStories.notes: MANUAL TASK - Human communication required. Skip in Ralph automation.
